verses.text: 耶路撒冷必荒廢七十年瑪代人亞哈隨魯的兒子大利烏被立為王，統治迦勒底國的第一年，
就是他作王的第一年，我但以理從經書上留意到耶和華臨到耶利米先知的話，指出耶路撒冷荒廢的年數必滿七十年。

words.note: Refers to holy writings, here Old Testament prophecies.
Used as a locative suffix meaning 'on' or 'in the context of'.
Lit. 'one who knows beforehand'.
Used here as a noun, 'the desolation of Jerusalem'.

verses.text: 但以理禁食祈禱於是我轉向主 神，禁食，披麻蒙灰，藉祈禱和懇求尋求他。

words.note: Idiomatic expression for repentance or mourning. Lit. 'wear sackcloth, cover with ashes'.

verses.text: 我向耶和華我的 神禱告、認罪，說：「主啊！偉大可畏的 神，你向那些愛你（「你」原文作「他」），遵守你（「你」原文作「他」）誡命的人守約施慈愛。

words.note: Describes something worthy of fear or reverence.
Refers to the quoted character '你'.
Common phrase in Bible translations noting textual variants.
Refers to the quoted character '他'.
Refers to the quoted character '你'.
Common phrase in Bible translations noting textual variants.
Refers to the quoted character '他'.
Often translates Hebrew 'hesed', denoting God's covenant loyalty.

verses.text: 我們犯了罪，行了不義，作了惡，背叛了你，偏離了你的誡命典章；
沒有聽從你的僕人眾先知，他們奉你的名向我們的君王、領袖、列祖和國中所有的人民說話。

words.note: Commonly used in biblical contexts for 'servant of God'.
Used in formal or religious contexts for acting by authority or command.
More common in historical or biblical texts.
More common in historical or biblical texts.

verses.text: 主啊！你是公義的；我們滿面羞愧，正如今日的光景；我們猶大人、耶路撒冷的居民，和被你趕逐到遠近各地的以色列眾人，都因對你不忠而滿面羞愧。

words.note: A respectful title for God or Jesus in the Bible.
A key theological term, especially in biblical contexts.
Often used in literary or descriptive contexts.
Often used in literary or older texts, including the Bible.
More common in formal or biblical contexts.
Often used in literary or descriptive contexts.

verses.text: 耶和華啊！我們和我們的君王、領袖、列祖，都滿面羞愧，因為我們得罪了你。

words.note: The personal name of God in the Old Testament.
More common in historical or biblical texts.
More common in historical or biblical texts.
Often used in literary or descriptive contexts.
Frequently used in biblical contexts to mean 'to sin against'.

verses.text: 雖然我們背叛了主我們的 神，他仍是滿有憐憫和饒恕。

words.note: A respectful title for God or Jesus in the Bible.
Used here as a proper noun for the monotheistic God.
Often used in literary or biblical contexts.
Frequently used in biblical contexts regarding divine forgiveness.

verses.text: 我們沒有聽從耶和華我們 神的話，沒有遵行他藉著他的僕人眾先知向我們頒布的律法。

words.note: The personal name of God in the Old Testament.
Used here as a proper noun for the monotheistic God.
More formal, often used for rules, laws, or teachings.
Commonly used in biblical contexts for 'servant of God'.
More formal, often used for laws or decrees.

verses.text: 以色列眾人都違背了你的律法，偏離了你，不聽從你的話，因此， 神的僕人摩西的律法書上所記載的咒詛和誓言，都傾倒在我們身上；我們實在得罪了 神。

words.note: Refers to God's law.
Refers to the Abrahamic God. The preceding space indicates reverence.

verses.text: 他實現了他的預言，按著他向我們和那些治理我們的官長所說過的話，使大災禍臨到我們身上；耶路撒冷所遇的災禍是在普天之下從未發生過的。

words.note: A classical idiom common in scripture.

verses.text: 這一切災禍是按著摩西的律法書上所記載的，臨到了我們身上，但我們仍沒有懇求耶和華我們的 神施恩，使我們離開罪孽，明白你的真理。

words.definition: did not have, there was no

words.note: Refers to divine truth.

verses.text: 所以耶和華留意使這災禍臨到我們身上，因為耶和華我們的 神在他所行的一切事上都是公義的，我們卻沒有聽從他的話。

words.definition: did not have, there was no

verses.text: 主我們的 神啊！你曾用強而有力的手把你的子民從埃及地領出來，使你自己得了名，好像今天一樣。現在，我們犯了罪，作了惡。

words.note: Common compound '犯罪' means 'to sin'.
Common compound '作惡' means 'to do evil'.

verses.text: 主啊！求你按著你的一切公義，使你的怒氣和忿怒轉離你的城耶路撒冷，就是你的聖山；因我們的罪和我們列祖的罪孽的緣故，耶路撒冷和你的子民成了在我們四圍的人羞辱的對象。
現在，我們的 神啊！求你垂聽你僕人的禱告和懇求；主啊！為了你自己的緣故，使你的臉光照你這荒涼了的聖所。

words.note: The leading space indicates reverence.

verses.text: 我的 神啊！求你側耳而聽，睜眼垂顧我們的荒涼，和那稱為你名下的城；因為我們向你懇求，並不是因著自己的義，而是因著你的大憐憫。

words.note: The leading space indicates reverence.
Refers to being associated with or belonging to someone's name/authority.

verses.text: 主啊！求你垂聽。主啊！求你赦免。主啊！求你應允而行。我的 神啊！為了你自己的緣故，求你不要耽延。因為你的城和你的子民都是稱為你名下的。」

words.note: The leading space indicates reverence.
Refers to being associated with or belonging to someone's name/authority.

verses.text: 七十個七的預言我還在說話、禱告、承認我的罪和我同胞以色列人的罪，為我 神的聖山，向耶和華我的 神懇求的時候；

words.note: A prophetic term referring to 70 weeks or periods of seven years (490 years).
The leading space indicates reverence.
The leading space indicates reverence.

verses.text: 我還在禱告說話的時候，我先前在異象中所見的那位樣貌像人的加百列，約在獻晚祭的時候，快速地飛（「快速地飛」原文意思難確定，或譯：「在精疲力竭時」）到我面前來。

words.note: A verb-object compound: 'to pray a prayer'.
Refers to a prophetic vision or revelation.
Refers to the daily evening offering in ancient Israelite worship.
Quoted phrase from the verse's parenthetical note.
A common idiom meaning utterly exhausted.
Short for 時候 (shíhou).

verses.text: 他向我解釋，說：「但以理啊！現在我來，要使你有智慧，有聰明。

words.definition: will, want to, to be about to

verses.text: 你開始懇求的時候，就有命令發出。因為你是大蒙眷愛的，所以我來告訴你；你要留意這信息，明白這異象。

words.note: Often refers to earnest prayer or petition to God.
A common biblical phrase for receiving divine favor.

breakdown.m: by means of, in order to

words.note: Refers to a prophetic vision or revelation.

verses.text: 「為你的同胞和你的聖城，已經定了七十個七，要結束過犯，終止罪惡，遮蓋罪孽，引進永義，封住異象和預言，並且膏抹至聖所（「至聖所」或譯：「至聖者」）。

words.note: Refers to Jerusalem in a religious context.
In this context, refers to 'sevens' of years.
Refers to a sin or trespass.
In a biblical context, implies atonement or forgiveness.
Emphasizes the evil nature and consequences of sin.
Refers to a prophetic vision or revelation.
To apply oil, often as a ritual for consecration or healing.
The inner sanctuary of the Tabernacle and Temple.
Quoted phrase from the verse's parenthetical note.
Refers to God or the Messiah. Quoted from parenthetical note.

verses.text: 你要知道，也要明白，從發出命令恢復和重建耶路撒冷，直到受膏君的時候，必有七個七；又有六十二個七（「必有七個七；又有六十二個七」或譯：「必有七個七和六十二個七」），耶路撒冷連廣場和濠溝，都必重新建造起來；那是一段困苦的時期。

words.note: Refers to a divinely appointed leader, like the Messiah.
Refers to a period of seven years (a 'week' of years).
Refers to a period of seven years (a 'week' of years).
Quoted phrase from the verse's parenthetical note.
Quoted phrase from the verse's parenthetical note.
Quoted phrase from the verse's parenthetical note.
Quoted phrase from the verse's parenthetical note.
Serves as a directional or resultative complement.

verses.text: 六十二個七以後，受膏者必被剪除，一無所有（「一無所有」或譯：「不再存在」）；那將要來的領袖的人民必毀滅這城和聖所。結局必像洪水而來；必有爭戰直到末了；荒涼的事已經定了。

words.note: Refers to a prophetic period of seven years.
A title for the Messiah.
Often used in prophetic contexts for divine judgment.
Here implies utter destitution or non-existence.
The character '袖' (sleeve) does not carry its literal meaning in this compound.
Commonly used for physical destruction.
Can be a verb 'to fight' or a noun 'warfare'.
The character '涼' (cool) does not carry its literal meaning here, merely part of the compound.

verses.text: 一七之內，他必和許多人堅立盟約；一七之半，他必使獻祭和供物終止；他必在殿裡（「殿裡」原文作「翼上」）；設立那使地荒涼的可憎的像（「可憎的像」原文是複數），直到指定的結局傾倒在那造成荒涼的人身上。」

words.note: Refers to a prophetic period of seven years.
Often used for establishing agreements or covenants.
Key theological term for God's covenants.
Refers to a prominent part of the temple, like a pinnacle or extension.
Functions as a demonstrative pronoun introducing a modifying clause.
The character '涼' (cool) does not carry its literal meaning here, merely part of the compound.
Often used in biblical contexts for things God detests.
In biblical contexts, often refers to an idol or graven image.
Often used for judgment or wrath being poured out.
